headline.main: THE MORMONS.; From the New-York Welsh Paper. A Curious Personal Narrative of an Escaped Mormon.

docs.lead_paragraph: MY DEAR BROTHER THOMAS:--It is with much pleasure that I write you these few lines, hoping that they will find you all alive and well. I can assure you that I am much better in health now than when I wrote to you before. I can now go about without a shade over my eyes.
docs.abstract: Letters from Jno Davis, an escaped Mormon

docs.lead_paragraph: We have from Kansas Governor WALKER'S proclamation in regard to the October election. It will be seen that in this document the Governor expressly and explicitly repudiates the doctrine so officiously set forth by Judge CATO, that none but those who have paid the Territorial tax are entitled to vote, and that for this position he has the direct authority of the President, the Secretary of State, and the whole Cabinet at Washington.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Broadway Theatre. QUARANTINE MATTERS.
A STARTLING REVELATION OF CITY LIFE.; THE VESTMAKER'S APPRENTICE; OR THE VAMPYRES OF SOCIETY.

docs.lead_paragraph: " ONE MORE UNFORTUNATE." The sun; was fast disappearing behind the Hoboken Hills at the close of a sweltering day in August. A sigh of relief seemed to ascend to Heaven from a half million of weary souls as the Day God rolled his fiery chariot Westward, and twilight, with her soothing, revivifying influence, approached to act the part of Nature's great nurse in fanning the fevered brows of heat-oppressed and overworked citizens.

byline.original: BY FRANCIS S. SMITH.Author of "Eveleen Wilson," " The Emigrant," etc

docs.lead_paragraph: A Writer in the Sidney Morning Herald urges the immediate formation of another expedition to search for the lost German traveler Leichardt. who, several years since, undertook to explore Central Australia, and has not since been heard of Various stories have been told of this murder, and others of his being kept prisoner by a ferocious tribe of Natives in the Interior, but no credit is attached to any of them.

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Hon. Justices Mitchell, Clerks and Davies. EXAMINERS APPOINTED. Yesterday, John B. Scoles, John L. Lawrence, and Jas. S. Slayter, Esqs., were appointed Examiners of applicants for admission to the Bar.

headline.main: THE NETHERLAND NEGRO.; Statement from Col. Netherland, concerning the Negro that he bought of Dr. Ross. Character and Conduct of the Negro.

docs.lead_paragraph: MESSRS. KINSLOE RICE: Some weeks ago "A Statement" issued from your office, written by SAMUEL SAWYER. This statement was, as you say in your card, smuggled through your press, "through the misrepresentations and fraud of the author, and your well denominate it in your card, as "an infamous and shamefully exaggerated publication."

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Board of Aldermen. Board of Councilmen. NEW AND PLEASANT AMUSEMENT. VIOLENT DEATHS..

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Aldermen met last evening, President CLANCY in the Chair. The resolution from the Board of Councilman, appointing a Joint Committee to report the names of suitable persons to act as inspectors and canvassers at the coming election, was adopted.

headline.main: INTERESTING RUSSIAN CEREMONY.; Celebration of the Natal Day of the Grand-Duke Constantine. Raising the Sternpost of the Leviathan Steam Propeller Frigate for the Czar.

docs.lead_paragraph: A very quiet convocation of distinguished personages was convened, yesterday, at the Ship-yard of WM. H. WEBB, Esq., to celebrate the anniversary of the birthday of the Grand-Duke CONSTANTINE, of Russia, by the formal raising of the sternpost of the immense steam propeller frigate, to be named in his honor the General Admiral.
docs.abstract: The Russian Propeller. Raising of the Stern-post
